byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Julie Turkewitz and Kassondra Cloos from Colorado Springs, Michael S. Schmidt from Washington, Ashley Southall from New York and Mitch Smith from Chicago.
byline.original: By DAVE PHILIPPS and JACK HEALY

abstract: Churchgoers in Colorado Springs gather to mourn victims of shooting at Planned Parenthood clinic; residents focus on reverence for victims and seek solidarity in conservative city where anti-abortion and pro-gun movements flourish.
lead_paragraph: The governor of Colorado and other national leaders condemned Friday’s attack as a form of terrorism in discussions on the factors behind such frequent shootings.

headline.main: Searching for Answers and Comfort After Killings at Planned Parenthood
headline.print_headline: Church Services in Colorado Springs Offer Words of Solace and Hope

snippet: The governor of Colorado and other national leaders condemned Friday’s attack as a form of terrorism in discussions on the factors behind such frequent shootings.
